name: WellBe
description:
A digital wellbeing platform for SME through to Enterprise customers. Wellbe is an engaging workplace Wellbeing tool, that helps to prevent health conditions, and that educates about and encourages self-care.

We are passionate about Wellbeing and believe that everyone should prioritise their Wellbeing, which will help them live an optimal life.

As a team we have all experienced anxiety, stress, or depression at some point during our lives and have not found an accessible solution that helps us deal with all of these issues, inside the workplace or outside of it.

We want to make self-care accessible to everyone. We know that everyone has different Wellbeing needs and so we want to build a platform that solves problems for everyone individually, not as a whole. 

Companies are waking up to the fact that they have a corporate responsibility for their employees’ mental health and wellbeing, and they must take preventative action in supporting their people.

team.name: Gemma Goodacre
team.bioHtml: An entrepreneurial leader. Second time founder. Passionate about technology & positive change!

jobs.title: Content Writer Intern
jobs.description:
Do you want to part of a wellbeing tech start-up revolution? Are you looking to gain experience in a tech start up?
We are an early stage digital wellness start-up for the workplace, and we are looking for bright & intelligent interns to help in content writing. 
You will be working for a fast-paced start-up and closely with the CEO. You will gain expertise across all lines of business and you will be exposed to multiple pockets of start-up life and have exposure to working with FSTE 100 customers.
Your role will include
•	Writing content on a range of wellness topics - physical, mental, social, emotional and financial 
•	Arrange interviews with industry experts for your content 
•	Working with publishing partnerships 
•	Review and potentially edit (if needed) our providers content to ensure it has the correct tone and messaging for our brand and users 
•	Sourcing content and images from external sources  
•	Responsible for managing our social media channels (Instagram, Linkedin and other channels) 
•	Innovating, you’ll be encouraged to help us on our journey of continuous improvement

You will be/have:

•	Strong writing skills
•	Inquisitive, passionate & enthusiastic about getting things done 
•	Creative and thorough, with a high attention to detail 
•	Positive, can do, go-getting energy 
•	Self-motivated & fast paced
•	Ability to take direction but also be a self-starter and come with solutions & ideas

Benefits 
•	Travel & expenses paid. This will turn into a paid role after 6 months.
•	Located in stunning offices in Spitalfields, a fantastic location! 
•	Fully stocked tea, coffee, fresh fruits, nuts, biscuits & chocolate/snacks daily! Pancake & bacon breakfasts monthly 
•	Opportunity to develop into a full-time paid role 
•	Large atrium where we screen live sporting events such as Wimbledon & Rugby (snacks included)!
•	Working with a very high energy, entrepreneurial founder who believes anything is possible and is an advocate of positive change

jobs.title: Partnerships & Sales Intern
jobs.description:
Do you want to part of a wellbeing tech start-up revolution? Are you looking to gain experience in a tech start up?

We are an early stage digital wellbeing start-up for the workplace, and we are looking for bright & intelligent interns to help with Partnerships.

You will be working for a fast-paced start-up and closely with the Co-Founders. You will be exposed to multiple pockets of start-up life and have exposure to working with FSTE 100 customers.

Your role will include:

•	Lead generation and reaching out to potential wellbeing partners 
•	Assessment of their fit for WellBe
•	On-boarding of Partners and administrative duties and regulatory requirements 
•	Reaching out to wellbeing product or service providers about benefits and offerings to our users 
•	Helping to conduct partner research 

You will be/have:
•	Good sales skills and comfortable with outreach via phone and email
•	Excellent customer relationships skills 
•	Ability to problem solve, nothing is unachievable 
•	Aptitude for learning 
•	Start-up mentality 
•	Inquisitive, passionate & enthusiastic about getting things done 
•	Creative and thorough, with a high attention to detail 
•	Positive, can do, go-getting energy 
•	Ability to take direction but also be a self-starter and come with solutions & ideas

This is a 3-month internship (unpaid), full time, you can work from home/remote or we have an office in Spitalfields, London. This has a real opportunity to turn into a paid role. You will report into a Co-Founder/CEO & Co-Founder/Chief of Product Officer who both have extensive start-up experience with VC backed companies, this will be an exceptional opportunity to be part of a very talented team, changing the future of wellbeing!

jobs.title: Wellbeing Coach Intern
jobs.description:
Do you want to part of a wellbeing tech start-up revolution? Are you looking to gain experience in a tech start up? Have you studied Psychology and want to make a difference to the world?

We are an early stage digital wellbeing start-up for the workplace, and we are looking for bright & intelligent Psychology interns.

You will be working for a fast-paced start-up and closely with the Co-Founders. You will be exposed to multiple pockets of start-up life and have exposure to working with FSTE 100 customers.

Your role will include:

•	Recommendations for content/services/discounts for users
•	Review users assessments and guide them on a journey of wellbeing 
•	Acting as a virtual coach to support the users, motivate and give sound guidance 
•	Research on latest wellbeing trends across services, e-learning and products to help people live well


You will be/have:
•	A Psychology degree 
•	Excellent customer relationships skills 
•	Ability to problem solve, nothing is unachievable 
•	Aptitude for learning 
•	Start-up mentality 
•	Inquisitive, passionate & enthusiastic about getting things done 
•	High attention to detail 
•	Positive, can do, go-getting energy 
•	Ability to take direction but also be a self-starter and come with solutions & ideas


This is a 3-month internship (unpaid), full time, you can work from home/remote or we have an office in Spitalfields, London. This has a real opportunity to turn into a paid role. You will report into a Co-Founder/CEO & Co-Founder/Chief of Product Officer who both have extensive start-up experience with VC backed companies, this will be an exceptional opportunity to be part of a very talented team, changing the future of wellbeing!
